content.title: Question 1
content.description: What are Binary Options?

fields.title: Answer:
fields.value:
Binary options are financial options that come with one of two payoff options: a fixed amount or nothing at all.The binary options trader buys a call when bullish on the asset in question, or a put when bearish. For a call/put to make money, the market must trade above/below the strike price at the expiration time.

📔 [More info on Binary Options](https://thalesmarket.medium.com/binary-options-101-6048a4227e8b)

content.title: Question 2
content.description: What is Thales?

fields.title: Answer:
fields.value:
Thales is a non-custodial binary options platform that taps into the infinite liquidity of the Synthetix ecosystem. Thales allows you to create, trade, and exercise binary options on Ethereum.
 To try out the Thales dapp head over to: [thales.market/markets](thales.market/markets)
 To learn more about how Thales works, visit our docs: [docs.thales.market](https://docs.thales.market/)

content.title: Question 3
content.description: Who was Thales?

fields.title: Answer:
fields.value:
Thales was an ancient Greek Chad. He was a philosopher, mathematician, astronomer and, most importantly, the person who exercised the first recorded options trade in western history.  

ℹ️ [More info](https://thalesmarket.medium.com/olive-oil-a-cornered-market-and-our-logo-421be0f2fc93)

content.title: Question 4
content.description: Is there a Thales token?

fields.title: Answer:
fields.value:
Thales token is expected to be released by the end of Q3 2021.Thales token planned usecase is platform fee accrual and governance of the protocol.
Stay tuned for more information about the token launch and the tokenomics soon!

content.title: Question 5
content.description: Is there a Thales token airdrop?

fields.title: Answer:
fields.value: 35% of the Thales token supply will be distributed to SNX stakers from past,present and future.This includes L2 and xsnx stakers. Past stakers will be able to claim a small part on token launch while the rest will be subjugated to vesting.

content.title: Question 6
content.description: Will the platform be on L2?

fields.title: Answer
fields.value: Thales is committed to rolling out on Optimism where the Synthetix debt pool will live. We expect to be live on L2 not long after the L1 MVP release.

content.title: Question 7
content.description: What currency does Thales use as collateral?

fields.title: Answer:
fields.value:
Thales uses sUSD, synthetic US dollar from the Synthetix protocol, as a settlement currency for its binary options.
 For more information about sUSD, visit: [docs.thales.market/binary-options/susd](https://docs.thales.market/binary-options/susd)

content.title: Question 8
content.description: From where does Thales pull its price feeds?

fields.title: Answer:
fields.value:
Thales is integrating Chainlink price feeds on Ethereum as an oracle solution.

 For more information about the Chainlink integration, visit: [thalesmarket.medium.com](https://thalesmarket.medium.com/thales-will-integrate-chainlink-price-feeds-to-secure-binary-options-outcomes-d7137f3199e1).

content.title: Question 9
content.description: What order books is Thales using?

fields.title: Answer:
fields.value:
Thales is integrating 0x protocol order books as a solution for trading Binary Options tokens on the platform.
 For more information about the 0x integration, visit: [first-0x-dao-grant-awarded](https://blog.0x.org/first-0x-dao-grant-awarded/)

content.title: Question 10
content.description: What is the current gas price?

fields.title: Answer:
fields.value: Gas prices currently not implemented.

fields.title: Answer:
fields.value: For a comprehensive and detailed guide on how to create your own Binary Options market on the Thales platform, visit: [market creation quide](https://docs.thales.market/using-thales/market-creation-guide )

content.title: Question 12
content.description: How do I trade Binary Options on the Thales marketplace?

fields.title: Answer:
fields.value:
How do I trade Binary Options on the Thales marketplace?
 For a comprehensive and detailed guide on how to create your own Binary Options market on the Thales platform, visit: [trading](https://docs.thales.market/using-thales/trading)

content.title: Question 13
content.description: How do I exercise my options on the Thales marketplace?

fields.title: Answer:
fields.value: For a comprehensive and detailed guide on how to exercise your options on the Thales marketplace, visit: [exercising](https://docs.thales.market/using-thales/exercising)

content.title: Question 14
content.description: How does Market Making work on the Thales platform?

fields.title: Answer:
fields.value:
A user who deposits sUSD into an existing market and mints new options is considered a Market Maker. There is a fixed 1% fee for Market Making, 0.5% goes to the pool creator and 0.5% goes to the protocol fee pool.
 For more information about how to mint options tokens, visit the Trade Module section of the Trading guide here: [trade-module](https://docs.thales.market/using-thales/trading#trade-module)

content.title: Question 15
content.description: What is the Thales Council?

fields.title: Answer:
fields.value:
Thales council is a governing DAO composed of 4 members elected by the community of token holders. The council members operate during specific epochs and after each epoch the community conducts a new election via Snapshots IPFS infrastructure.
 Thales council's main responsibilities are conducting TIP reviews, interviewing the TIP proposers,  debating the implications of proposed changes and coordinating with the Protocol DAO regarding the technical implications and implementations.

content.title: Question 16
content.description: What are TIPs?

fields.title: Answer:
fields.value:
TIP is an abbreviation of Thales Improvement Proposal. TIPs are adapted from the EIP (Ethereum Improvement Proposal) and SIP (Synthetix Improvement Proposal) standards and they represent an artifact used to describe proposed changes to the core Thales protocol. A well designed TIP should feature the motivation, technical specifications and rationale behind design decisions relating to the proposed idea.
 More information about TIPs, their general purpose and guidelines can be found here:
 >> https://gov.thales.io/docs/tip-1 <<

content.title: Question 17
content.description: How is Thales governance structured?

fields.title: Answer:
fields.value:
The Thales protocol governance is made out of three core DAOs: 

 - Thales council

 - Protocol DAO

 - Thales DAO

 Each of the DAOs has its own set of responsibilities and all of them together share the same mission of enabling the most optimal, efficient and censorship-resistant way for the Thales community to be the main driving force of the project.
 For more information about Thales Council, type: **!faq Thales Council**
 For more information about Protocol DAO, type: **!faq Protocol Dao**
 For more information about Thales DAO, type: **!faq Thales DAO**

content.title: Question 18
content.description: What is the Protocol DAO?

fields.title: Answer:
fields.value: Thales Protocol DAO is a decentralized autonomous organization assigned to be the owner of the Thales protocol core smart contracts. Its main responsibilities are upgrading and releasing new contracts (on behalf of the Thales Council), implementation of TIPs and operational security.

content.title: Question 19
content.description: What is the Thales DAO?

fields.title: Answer:
fields.value: Thales DAO is a DAO with the purpose of managing the treasury of the protocol. It is responsible for properly incentivizing the other governing bodies and to support further developments of the protocol. All of the DAO roles are paid a certain stipend by the Thales DAO.

content.title: Question 20
content.description: Is there a Thales research forum?

fields.title: Answer:
fields.value:
Thales research forum can be found here:
 >> https://research.thales.io/ <<

 Thales research forum is the place for all focused discussions related to the Thales project where users can directly contribute their input to the project’s growth and development.
